title: Duck à l'Orange (Mini)
description: A concentrated, elegant rendition of classic French Duck à l'Orange: seared duck breasts with a glossy orange-citrus sauce, finished with a touch of honey and pan juices for balance. Fast enough for a special weeknight, this mini version focuses on crisp skin, tender meat and bright, lightly sweetened orange notes.

ingredients.notes: about 170 g (6 oz) each, score skin in a crosshatch without cutting meat
mixed with splash of water to thicken if needed

steps.text: Bring duck breasts to room temperature, pat skin dry and score skin in a crosshatch pattern; season both sides with about half the salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium; add olive oil and place duck breasts skin-side down. Render the fat, pressing gently, until skin is deep golden and crisp, about 8-10 minutes. Spoon off excess fat into a container as it accumulates.

Flip breasts and sear meat side for 1 minute to brown. Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and roast until internal temperature reaches 57–60°C (135–140°F) for medium-rare, about 6-8 minutes depending on thickness. Remove duck to a cutting board, tent loosely with foil and rest.
Pour off most of the fat from the skillet, leaving any fond. Return skillet to medium heat on the stovetop, add chopped shallot and sauté until softened, about 1-2 minutes.

Deglaze with white wine (or a splash of stock) scraping up browned bits, then add orange juice, orange zest, chicken stock and red wine vinegar. Bring to a simmer and reduce by about half until slightly syrupy, about 6-8 minutes.

Whisk in honey, then swirl in cold cubed butter off heat to emulsify the sauce; season with remaining salt and pepper to taste. If sauce needs thickening, stir in cornstarch slurry and simmer 30–60 seconds until glossy.
Slice rested duck breasts crosswise into medallions. Spoon warm orange sauce over the sliced duck, garnish with chopped thyme or parsley and a little extra orange zest, and serve immediately.
